item.title: Credit Card Bills, Insurance Premiums To Get Costlier Under GST
item.description: Credit card providers, banks and insurers have started alerting their customers to pay higher tax post implementation of Goods and Services Tax (GST) from July 1. Customers currently pay 15 per cent service tax for such services. Starting from July 1, 2017 the GST will replace all indirect taxes like service tax and VAT. Financial services and telecom have been put in the 18 per cent GST slab. SBI Card has sent SMS to its customers alerting about the higher incidence of tax.

item.title: Demonetisation again? There are signs of another currency ban coming
item.description: Is the Central government quietly planning another round of demonetisation? A large number of people believe the Rs 2,000 note will be scrapped. Now the talk has reached Parliament too. The Opposition in Rajya Sabha today asked Finance Minister Arun Jaitley to clarify whether the government has decided to scrap the newly launched Rs 2,000 note. However, Jaitley did not respond even as many Opposition members insisted for clarification from him.

item.title: Modi's war on bad debt: Why you might not see more Vijay Mallyas in future
item.description: Just two years ago, when Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s government was planning to clean up the bad debt of state banks, it seemed a messy and arduous task. But slowly, the government has tightened its grip on the problem. After the Centre brought in the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, 2016 and backed it up with several other measures, the message for India Inc is loud and clear – Default is a dangerous situation to be in.

item.title: No penalty for late ITR this year but here are 4 important reasons to file it in time
item.description: The due date for filing income tax return for individuals - July 31 - is fast approaching but several people think that if one has paid all one’s taxes there is no adverse consequence even if one misses the tax return filing deadline. This is more so because the proposed penalty for delayed filing of income tax return kicks in from next year and is not applicable for returns filed for FY16-17.

item.title: Now Banks Accounts To Be Blocked: 10 Points
item.description: India had entered into an agreement with the United States for implementation of the Foreign Accounts Tax Compliance Act (FATCA) with effect from August 31, 2015. Bank accounts that were opened between July 1, 2014 and August 31, 2015 and are not in compliance with FATCA (Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act) provisions will be blocked. The Income Tax Department had set a deadline of April 30 for FATCA compliance for these accounts.

item.title: RBI To Issue Rs 200 Notes In Coming Months: Report
item.description: The Reserve Bank is expected to introduce Rs 200 notes in the coming months to ease pressure on lower-denomination currencies that are in short supply. The new notes of Rs 200 should be out before the end of 2017 and will greatly help in narrowing the demand and supply gap in smaller-denomination currency bills, sources said. They also said that there is no immediate plan to re-introduce Rs 1,000 notes.

item.title: Taxman Probing 30,000 Cases Where ITRs Revised Post-Notes Ban
item.description: The Income Tax Department is probing over 30,000 cases of alleged tax evasion wherein the income tax returns (ITRs) were revised by assessees post-demonetisation, Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) chief Sushil Chandra said on Monday. The ITRs filed after November 8 last year were scrutinised against their earlier tax compliance following which these cases were detected, he said. “We are taking action in these instances,” Mr Chandra told reporters on the sidelines of an event to mark the 157th Income Tax day here.

item.title: ‘Rooted’ Phones May Soon Have No Place In Modi’s Cashless India
item.description: India is considering a ban on smartphones with modified firmware from all of its cashless payment platforms due to security concerns, according to the chief of National Payments Corporation of India which manages all retail payment systems in the country. “These smartphones have a certain degree of vulnerability in the Unified Payments Interface (UPI), the Bharat Interface for Money (BHIM) or any kind of financial system”, AP Hota, chief executive officer and managing director of NPCI told BloombergQuint.
